t: This*p is what the Lord*s says: “Maintain*pn justice and*ld do what is right, for*ln my salvation is close at hand and*ld my righteousness will soon be revealed.
Blessed*ln is the one who does this— the*ld person who holds it fast, who*ln keeps the Sabbath without desecrating it, and*ld keeps their hands from doing any evil.”
Let*pn no foreigner who is bound to the Lord*s say, “The*ld Lord*s will surely exclude me from his people.” And*ln let no eunuch complain, “I*ld am only a dry tree.”
For*p this is what the Lord*s says: “To*pn the eunuchs who keep my Sabbaths, who*ld choose what pleases me and*ld hold fast to my covenant—
to*ln them I will give within my temple and its walls a*ld memorial and a name better*ld than sons and daughters; I*ln will give them an everlasting name that*ld will endure forever.

And*ln foreigners who bind themselves to the Lord*s to*ld minister to him, to*ln love the name of the Lord,*s and*ld to be his servants, all*ln who keep the Sabbath without desecrating it and*ld who hold fast to my covenant—

these*ln I will bring to my holy mountain and*ld give them joy in my house of prayer. Their*ln burnt offerings and sacrifices will*ld be accepted on my altar; for*ln my house will be called a*ld house of prayer for all nations.”
The*ln Sovereign Lord*s declares— he*ld who gathers the exiles of Israel: “I*ln will gather still others to them besides*ld those already gathered.”
Come,*pn all you beasts of the field, come*ld and devour, all you beasts of the forest!
Israel’s*ln watchmen are blind, they*ld all lack knowledge; they*ln are all mute dogs, they*ld cannot bark; they*ln lie around and dream, they*ld love to sleep.
They*ln are dogs with mighty appetites; they*ld never have enough. They*ln are shepherds who lack understanding; they*ld all turn to their own way, they*ld seek their own gain.
“Come,”*ln each one cries, “let me get wine! Let*ld us drink our fill of beer! And*ln tomorrow will be like today, or*ld even far better.”
